glossentry.glossdef: A planetary gear transmission system in the automobile (1908-1927) that managed power transfer from the engine to the wheels. This innovative design used foot pedals instead of a gear shift lever, featuring two forward speeds and one reverse, with all gears operating in an oil bath for continuous lubrication.

glossBody.glossUsage: The term is frequently referenced when discussing early automotive engineering innovations and in restoration contexts, particularly noting its unique planetary gear design and pedal-operated system.
